title: Statistics and Data Analysis

vocab.definition: The collection, organization, and analysis of numerical data
The average of a set of numbers, found by adding all values and dividing by the count
The middle number in a set of data when arranged in order
The number that appears most often in a set of data
The difference between the highest and lowest values in a data set

teachingNotes: Use real data sets that students can relate to. Practice creating different types of graphs. Discuss when each measure of central tendency is most useful.

sample.question: What is the middle number in an ordered set of data called?
Which is a measure of center?
The average is also called the ________.
The most frequent number is the ________.
The difference between high and low is ________.

truefalse.question: The mean is found by adding all values and dividing by the number of values.
The mode is always the largest number.
The median is the middle value when data is ordered.
Range is the sum of all values.
The mean is also called the average.
Data sets always have a mode.
The median and mean are always equal.
Mode is the least frequent value.

multiplechoice.question: What is the mode of this data set: 3, 5, 7, 5, 9, 5, 2?
Which is a measure of central tendency?

fillintheblank.question: The difference between the highest and lowest values is the ________.
The average of data is called the ________.
The middle value when ordered is the ________.
The most frequent value is the ________.
To find mean, add values and ________ by count.
The ________ shows how spread out data is.
Mean, median, and mode are measures of ________.
The ________ is found by ordering data and finding the middle.
If a value appears most, it is the ________.

shortanswer.question: Find the mean of these test scores: 85, 92, 78, 95, 90.
Explain how to find the median.
expectedAny: arrange in order, pick middle value

shortanswer.question: Why is mean called the average?
When is median better than mean?

wordProblems.question: A basketball player scored these points in 5 games: 12, 18, 15, 21, 14. What is the range of his scores?
Test scores are 78, 85, 90, 82, 85. What is the mode?
Temperatures were 65°, 70°, 75°. What is the mean temperature?
Heights in cm: 150, 155, 160. What is the median?
Sales were $20, $30, $40, $50. What is the range?
Quiz scores: 8, 9, 10, 8, 9, 8. What is the mode?
Ages are 10, 12, 14, 16. What is the mean age?
Prices: $5, $10, $15. What is the median price?
Distances: 2 mi, 5 mi, 8 mi, 3 mi. What is the range?
Weights: 100 lb, 120 lb, 110 lb, 120 lb. What is the mode?
